page.title: 03FARMING
page.content: Most of the farms in the Loxley area are dairy farms.At one of the largest, {"Lea Bank Farm"}there are 650 cows.Each cow produces 5 gallons of milk a day, so this farm alone produces 13,650 gallons of milk a week.The area to the west of Loxley is mainly rich grassland suitable for dairy herds. Sometimes,after heavy snowfalls, milk collection is difficult. The farmers usually manage to ensure that the supplies reach the main road for collection by the tankers. Most people in the area buy milk from the local milkmen who obtain their milk from the nearby farms. Some are farmers themselves.
